definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]

sentences.english: India borders the Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 印度和太平洋不搭界啊。

sentences.english: They knew each other by sight, but their orbits did not touch.
sentences.chinese: 他們見面認識，但各自的生活圈子互不搭界。

sentences.english: In many ways they are contrasts, and on the surface they may seem an unlikely pair.
sentences.chinese: 很多方面兩人都是相對的，表面看來似乎兩人不搭界。

definition: to keep close to the edge/near the mark/close to (the true figure)/relevant (used with negative to mean totally irrelevant)
erhua variant of 挨邊|挨边[ai1 bian1]
to have a connection with/to be close (to reality)/to be relevant/to have one's hand in
to be completely unrelated to one another (idiom)/irrelevant
pinyin: feng1 ma3 niu2 bu4 xiang1 ji2

definition: (separated only by) a narrow strip of water
to be located at/to be situated in
unwell/indisposed/out of sorts/euphemism or honorific for ill
to merge with/interlinking/to join with/to interlock
